ovdesc.p: This application contains BIC data updated from SWIFT. BIC database is a SWIFT directory that lists institution identifiers recognised by the financial industry (for example, BICs, CHIPS UIDs, and national clearing codes).BIC Database Plus is expanded to include SEPA identifiers, such as national bank identifiers used in IBANs, IBAN formats, and BICs issued with IBANs.
The expanded database evolves into a new directory called BICPlusIBAN Directory.

desc.p: Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Branch code associated to the BIC CODE.
Branch code associated to UNIQUE BIC CODE.
This field is used to maintain the existence of a Swift key with a particular bic code. An input of Null denotes that no swift key exists.
Optional Field
Valid values are YES and Null

Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Service codes: value added services that the financial institution has subcribed to. For example: RTGSplus in Germany, BIREL in Italy.
Branch code associated to ROUTING BIC CODE
Date on which the uploaded BIC record was last updated.
ISO country code prefix of the IBAN that the bank issues.
Date on which the national ID has been removed by the national authority.

The BIC code ID must be 11 characters long. The first 4 characters are the Bank Code, followed by 2 characters which are the ISO-Country Code followed by 5 characters which are the Location Code identifyers.
1. Must be 11 characters long
The 5
For example :
ABUTGB21XXX
This is the location of the branch of the financial institution.
Wherever possible, the uploaded field is reformatted to show the following logical groups of information, in the following sequence :-"Suburb, City, Region, State"
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This is the Tag Identifier.
Record Identifier : 'BI'
Specific information from the National record for the financial institution.
BIC branch qualifiers. For example : ADM = Adminstration,
BKO = Back office.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
National ID.For search purposes, Value is unique in the data file per country code. The value is unique within the active records(that is, only records with a modification flag of U,A or M)
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Flag to indicate a manually input record
This field is updated as Yes, when the record is modified manually.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This is the flag which indicates whether or not there has been a change in the record since the last release of the CD.
Contains one of the following values
'A' Addition since last BIC+ Directory
'D' Deletion since last BIC+ Directory
'U' Unchanged since last BIC+ Directory
'M' Modification since last BIC+ Directory
'E' Expired : Reserved for future use.
IBAN National ID. For search purposes,value is unique in the data file per IBAN COUNTRY CODE. The value is unique within the active records(that is, only records with a modification flag of U,A or M)
The Post Office Box (POB) location.
Wherever possible during the upload, the field is reformatted to show the following logical groups of information, in the following sequence :- POB City- POB State.
Optional field.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
National ID as included in the IBAN.
National identifier of the bank.For some countries, 2 types of national ID co-exist. "Other National ID" fields are used for these special cases.
Bank Identifier code (bank, country and location code)
Bank code (4 char)
Country code (2 char)
Location code (2 char)

This is the city in which the branch of the institution resides.
Wherever possible, the field is standardized. This means that main cities are spelled the same way across the file.

This is the actual physical address of where the BIC code relates.
Wherever possible the uploaded field is reformatted to show the following logical groups of information, in the following sequence (each logical group is delimited by ':')
. Contact Person
. Building, Floor,Apartment
. Street Number, Street Name, Street Cardinal Point
. Second Street Number,Second Street Name,Second Street Cardinal Point.
Bank Identifier code (bank, country and location code)
Bank code (4 char)
Country code (2 char)
Location code (2 char)

The full postal code of the branch for the financial institution.
Validation Rules:.
Wherever possible the field is standardised.
National identifier of the bank.For some countries, 2 types of national ID co-exist. "Other National ID" fields are used for these special cases.
The name of the institution.
This is the Post Office Box (POB) number that relates to financial institution
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
National identifier of the bank.This field contains the National bank code for the financial institution (for example, BSC codes for UK banks).
The branch infomation relevant to this BIC code.
This is the country name that the financial institution resides in.
The Country Name is normalized to its ISO equivalent.
Bank Identifier code (bank, country and location code)
Bank code (4 char)
Country code (2 char)
Location code (2 char)
For search purposes, the value is unique within the active records(that is, only records with a modification flag of U,A or M)
Bank code of the parent BIC.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
POB Country name.
The POB Country Name is normalized to its ISO equivalent.

This is the routing or processing BIC to which the Euro payment must be sent. ROUTING BIC CODE is meant for SWIFT messaging purposes. When the IBAN BIC CODE is a non-connected BIC(BIC1), the ROUTING BIC CODE is filled to provide an addressable code on the SWIFT network.
Type of financial institution. For example : a bank or a broker.
The unique key of the record in the file. The key is made up of the ISO country code and a sequential number of 6 digits.
